Package distributions

Class Distribution<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • distributions.Distribution<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The types of objects to be sampled over, typically actions.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Distribution_Equal, Distribution_Normal
    public abstract class Distribution<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Framework for sampling from a discrete set on different distributions. Extend this to make specific distribution types.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Distribution

        public Distribution()

    • Method Detail

      • randOnDistribution

        public abstract T randOnDistribution​(java.util.List<T> pool)
        Return a sample from a given set according to the rules of the distribution. Selection should be random, but weighted in whatever way the distribution defines.
        Parameters:
        pool - Set of objects from which the sample will be selected.
        Returns:
        An element of the input list selected randomly according to the rules of the distribution.

      • randSample

        public T randSample​(java.util.List<T> pool)
        Return a random sample from a given set. The element is randomly selected without any regards to the distribution's rules.
        Parameters:
        pool - Set of objects from which the sample will be selected.
        Returns:
        An element of the input list selected randomly according to the rules of the distribution.

      • chooseASet

        public boolean chooseASet​(java.util.List<T> list1,
                          java.util.List<T> list2)
        Choose between two lists of objects according to the rules of the distribution. A sample is picked from the combined list of objects and then checked to see which input list it came from.
        Parameters:
        list1 - First candidate list of objects.
        list2 - Second candidate list of objects.
        Returns:
        Boolean representing which candidate list was chosen. True means list1, false means list2.
